text: I have and I have decided that I will
grant a bail under the following
conditions a judge set bail today for
Dominique strauss-kahn who is the former
chief of the IMF under the terms of the
bail mr. strauss-kahn is gonna have to
put up a million dollars cash he's also
gonna have to file a five-million-dollar
pond and he's also agreed to be secured
in an apartment that his wife rented in
Manhattan and as part of saying in that
apartment he's gonna have to be under
24-hour surveillance by a security group
and not only will he have video
surveillance and he'll have an ankle
monitor but can also be a live guard
outside of his building seven days a
week electronically and by at least one
armed human being guard at all times the
scene out here today was a frenzy there
was hundreds of reporters from all
across the country in the courtroom
their reporters were packed
shoulder-to-shoulder and in fact some of
the reporters have to be put in the jury
box because there was not enough room
mr. Charles Townes wife and Sinclair and
one of his daughters Camille who lives
in Manhattan is a Columbia students both
of them were in the courtroom today when
mr. strauss-kahn walked in today he was
wearing a gray suit he had on navy blue
shirt and he was looking well shaven and
clean-cut which is a very different
image from what we've seen of him in
past days when he's been pretty haggard
and tired looking as he walked in he saw
his wife and his daughter in the front
row and he gave them a small smile one
thing we also learned today is that mr.
strauss-kahn was indicted so what that
means is that the case now goes to
Supreme Court here in Manhattan so that
means in next month the judge set a date
for mr. strauss-kahn to reappear in
ports at which point he will be total of
his charges and the case will continue
from there presumably both sides will
then work out their strategy and proceed
to thwart a trial
